## Residential Project Complexity Factors

::: {style="margin: 48px 0;"}
### Understanding Your Project Scale

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr)); gap: 24px; margin: 32px 0;"}

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Small-Scale Development
**Units:** 10-30 dwellings  
**Type:** Townhouses/low-rise  
**Complexity:** Low-Medium  
**Timeline:** 3-5 days  
**Typical Cost:** £1,800-2,500/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- 2-3 storey construction
- Standard construction methods
- Limited common areas
- Surface parking
- Basic amenities
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Medium-Scale Development
**Units:** 30-80 apartments  
**Type:** 4-8 storey blocks  
**Complexity:** Medium-High  
**Timeline:** 5-8 days  
**Typical Cost:** £2,000-2,800/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- RC frame or masonry
- Lift access required
- Shared amenity spaces
- Basement/podium parking
- Enhanced specifications
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Large-Scale Development
**Units:** 80-200+ apartments  
**Type:** High-rise towers  
**Complexity:** High  
**Timeline:** 8-10 days  
**Typical Cost:** £2,200-3,200/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- RC frame construction
- Multiple core/lift banks
- Extensive amenities
- Multi-level parking
- Premium specifications
:::

:::
:::

## Key Cost Drivers in Residential Projects

::: {style="margin: 48px 0; padding: 32px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
### Typical Cost Breakdown (per sqm)

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 32px; margin: 24px 0;"}

::: {style=""}
#### Structure & Envelope (45-50%)
- Foundations & substructure: £180-280/sqm
- RC frame or masonry: £280-420/sqm
- External envelope & windows: £200-350/sqm
- Roofing: £80-140/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £740-1,190/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Internal Fit-Out (25-30%)
- Partitions & doors: £120-180/sqm
- Kitchen & bathroom pods: £200-300/sqm
- Floor finishes: £60-100/sqm
- Decorations: £40-70/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £420-650/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### MEP Services (15-20%)
- Heating & hot water: £80-120/sqm
- Electrical & lighting: £70-110/sqm
- Ventilation systems: £50-80/sqm
- Fire protection: £40-70/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £240-380/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Other Elements (10-15%)
- Common areas & amenities: £100-180/sqm
- External works: £80-140/sqm
- Preliminaries (10-12%): £200-320/sqm
- Contingency (5-8%): £120-200/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £500-840/sqm
:::

:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin-top: 32px; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-charcoal); border-radius: 8px;"}
<h3 style="color: #FFFFFF; margin-top: 0;">Total Typical Range: £1,900-3,060/sqm</h3>
<p style="color: #FFFFFF; font-style: italic;">(Excluding land, fees, and marketing costs)</p>

<p style="color: #FFFFFF;"><strong>NOTE:</strong> Actual costs vary significantly based on:</p>
<ul style="color: #FFFFFF; text-align: left; display: inline-block;">
<li>Location and ground conditions</li>
<li>Height and structural system</li>
<li>Specification level and finishes</li>
<li>Parking requirements (surface vs basement)</li>
<li>Amenity provision and communal areas</li>
</ul>
:::
:::

## Our Residential Estimation Process

::: {.process-steps}
::: {.process-step}
#### Initial Review & Setup

**Day 1 (4-6 hours)**

**What We Do:**
- Review BIM model (IFC/Revit) or 2D drawings
- Identify unit types and variations
- Verify planning compliance requirements
- Assess common areas and amenities
- Set up unit type libraries

**Client Provides:**
- Architectural drawings/models
- Specification documents
- Planning permissions/requirements
- Site information
- Any specific tender requirements

**Output:** Project plan and timeline confirmation
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Automated Quantity Extraction

**Days 1-3**

**What We Do:**
- Extract all structural elements
- Quantify each unit type
- Calculate common areas separately
- Measure external works
- Count MEP fixtures and fittings

**Technology:**
- BIM 5D extraction tools
- Repetitive unit automation
- Cross-checking with 2D documents

**Output:** Complete quantity take-off (BOQ)
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Cost Application & Analysis

**Days 3-6**

**What We Do:**
- Apply current market rates
- Factor in project location
- Calculate unit-specific costs
- Include preliminaries (10-12%)
- Add appropriate contingency (5-8%)
- Run alternative scenarios if requested

**Database Sources:**
- BCIS (UK) / Rawlinsons (Australia)
- Live supplier quotes
- Recent project benchmarks

**Output:** Detailed cost estimate with breakdown
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Quality Review & Reporting

**Days 6-8**

**What We Do:**
- Technical peer review
- Check against benchmarks
- Verify calculations
- Prepare visual cost breakdown
- Create executive summary
- Schedule presentation/meeting

**Deliverables:**
- Executive summary (2-3 pages)
- Cost per unit type breakdown
- BOQ with quantities and rates
- Cost per sqm analysis
- Alternative scenarios (if requested)

**Format:** PDF + Excel workbooks
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Presentation & Handover

**Day 8-10**

**What We Do:**
- Present findings to development team
- Explain key cost drivers
- Review value engineering options
- Discuss any risks or assumptions
- Answer questions
- Provide ongoing support

**Meeting Options:**
- In-person (UK only)
- Video conference (all locations)
- Written Q&A via email

**Support:** 30 days post-delivery included
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin: 32px 0; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
**Typical Total Duration:** 7-10 working days from BIM model receipt to final report  
**Express Service:** Available for urgent projects (4-5 days) at 25% premium
:::

## Frequently Asked Questions

::: {.faq-section}
::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's the largest residential project you've estimated?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We've worked on developments ranging from 10-unit townhouse complexes to 200+ apartment towers, including mixed-use developments with retail and commercial elements. Our 5D BIM workflow scales effectively for any project size.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you handle mixed-use developments with retail/commercial elements?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Absolutely. We regularly estimate mixed-use projects combining residential, retail, office, and parking elements. We provide separate cost breakdowns for each use category and handle the interface complexities between different uses.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How quickly can you provide a feasibility estimate for planning applications?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: For planning-stage feasibility estimates based on concept drawings, we can typically provide a cost range within 2-3 days. This uses benchmarks and parametric estimating appropriate for early-stage decision making.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What if the developer wants to change the unit mix after your estimate?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Because we work with 5D BIM and unit type libraries, we can quickly recalculate costs for different unit mixes within hours. This includes adjusting the balance between 1-bed, 2-bed, and 3-bed apartments.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Do you include affordable housing requirements in your estimates?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we can provide separate cost breakdowns for market-rate and affordable housing units, accounting for specification differences and any grant funding implications. We understand Section 106 requirements and help optimize the affordable housing mix.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you provide cost breakdowns by construction phase?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we regularly prepare cost breakdowns by construction phase, building block, or release phase. This is particularly useful for staged developments where different blocks are built at different times or for phased funding requirements.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How do you handle varying ground conditions across a site?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We rely on the client's ground investigation reports to assess foundation requirements. For sites with varying conditions, we zone the development and apply appropriate foundation solutions (piled, raft, strip footings) based on the geotechnical recommendations for each zone.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's your fee structure for residential projects?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Fees vary based on project size, complexity, and timeline. As a rough guide:
- Small development (10-30 units): £2,500-4,500
- Medium development (30-80 units): £4,500-8,000
- Large development (80-150 units): £8,000-14,000
- Major development (150+ units): £14,000-25,000

Express service (4-5 days) carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.
:::
:::
:::
